db:abstract.db:para: The QSemaphoreReleaser class provides exception-safe deferral of a QSemaphore::release() call.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.10.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QSemaphoreReleaser can be used wherever you would otherwise use QSemaphore::release(). Constructing a QSemaphoreReleaser defers the release() call on the semaphore until the QSemaphoreReleaser is destroyed (see RAII pattern).
You can use this to reliably release a semaphore to avoid dead-lock in the face of exceptions or early returns:
db:section.db:programlisting: // ... do something that may throw or return early sem.release();
db:section.db:para: If an early return is taken or an exception is thrown before the sem.release() call is reached, the semaphore is not released, possibly preventing the thread waiting in the corresponding sem.acquire() call from ever continuing execution.
When using RAII instead:
this can no longer happen, because the compiler will make sure that the QSemaphoreReleaser destructor is always called, and therefore the semaphore is always released.
QSemaphoreReleaser is move-enabled and can therefore be returned from functions to transfer responsibility for releasing a semaphore out of a function or a scope:
A QSemaphoreReleaser can be canceled by a call to cancel(). A canceled semaphore releaser will no longer call QSemaphore::release() in its destructor.

db:section.db:title: QSemaphoreReleaser::QSemaphoreReleaser()
db:section.db:para: Default constructor. Creates a QSemaphoreReleaser that does nothing.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QSemaphoreReleaser::QSemaphoreReleaser(QSemaphore &sem, int n = 1)
db:section.db:para: Constructor. Stores the arguments and calls sem.release(n) in the destructor.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QSemaphoreReleaser::QSemaphoreReleaser(QSemaphore *sem, int n = 1)
db:section.db:para: Constructor. Stores the arguments and calls sem->release(n) in the destructor.

db:section.db:title: QSemaphoreReleaser::QSemaphoreReleaser(QSemaphoreReleaser &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move constructor. Takes over responsibility to call QSemaphore::release() from other, which in turn is canceled.

db:section.db:title: QSemaphoreReleaser::~QSemaphoreReleaser()
db:section.db:para: Unless canceled, calls QSemaphore::release() with the arguments provided to the constructor, or by the last move assignment.

db:section.db:title: QSemaphore *QSemaphoreReleaser::cancel()
db:section.db:para: Cancels this QSemaphoreReleaser such that the destructor will no longer call semaphore()->release(). Returns the value of semaphore() before this call. After this call, semaphore() will return nullptr.
To enable again, assign a new QSemaphoreReleaser:

db:section.db:title: QSemaphore *QSemaphoreReleaser::semaphore() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a pointer to the QSemaphore object provided to the constructor, or by the last move assignment, if any. Otherwise, returns nullptr.

db:section.db:title: void QSemaphoreReleaser::swap(QSemaphoreReleaser &other)
db:section.db:para: Exchanges the responsibilites of *this and other.
Unlike move assignment, neither of the two objects ever releases its semaphore, if any, as a consequence of swapping.
Therefore this function is very fast and never fails.

db:section.db:title: QSemaphoreReleaser &QSemaphoreReleaser::operator=(QSemaphoreReleaser &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move assignment operator. Takes over responsibility to call QSemaphore::release() from other, which in turn is canceled.
If this semaphore releaser had the responsibility to call some QSemaphore::release() itself, it performs the call before taking over from other.
